name: Site Table of Contents
author: Mike Ginese

sections.description:
Site Table of Contents plugin allows a users to easily create a page that lists all posts and their respective categories in an easy to use and dynamic way.

Stats and Reporting

None at this time.

Support

Please direct all questions to linktothispage@CreativeRealEstateInvestingGuide.com

What’s Changed?

Version 0.3
– Fixed problem with no default array value in the category exclude option. By default, the option was set to a string value when it should have been an array value. Caused an error until the user modified the options for the first time.

Version 0.2
– Fixed problem where the TOC only showed 5 posts even if there were more.
Version 0.1
– Initial public beta released. Just install and activate. Change options as required.
sections.installation:
1. Download the plugin archive and expand it (you’ve likely already done this).
  2. Put the ‘site-table-of-contents’ directory into your wp-content/plugins/ directory.
  3. Go to the Plugins page in your WordPress Administration area and click ‘Activate’ for Site Table of Contents.
  4. Use the options to modify how the plug-in is displayed.
  5. Place where you would like the table of contents to appear. Use the HTML editor when placing the code.
